Sovereign Grand Inspector Comrade
Incredibly brave, incredibly rich, and yet not incredibly stupid, Olorin the Grey Wizard is the most successful leader that the Comradeship has had in a long time.
Glammyding
The magical Halfling sword known as Glammyding increases its wielder's strength, while striking fear into Orcs and Goblins.
Cathay Fireworks
Olorin's special reserve of fireworks from Cathay, "borrowed" from their last diplomatic mission, whenever that was.
Bottomless Hat of Rabbit
Olorin is much admired in the Moot for hisability to pull rabbits out of his hat. Tasty rabbits, too.
Leader of Halflings
Olorin is used to dealing with the usual rag-tag bunch of Halflings the Comradeship always attracts.
Rockets' Grey Glare
Olorin's been meaning to try this for ages, and has finally gotten the time to do it: enchant his rockets with the Grey Wind of Magic.
The Grey Wanderer
All members of the Comradeship are wanderers, all looking for somewhere to go. Olorin regularly gives them that "where".
Comradeship Recruitment Drive
The Comradeship, we're always hiring.
Firework Shows
Olorin is much admired in the Moot for his fireworks displays. His enemies, however, are far less understand of his explosive obsession.
Eagle Lover
After being saved from an embarassing situation by an eagle (it's a long story) Olorin has become very fond of these great birds.
Conjurer of Tricks
Olorin knows a parlor trick or two, while usually employed to entertain Mootfolk, they might just have some uses out in the larger world.
Agent of the Grey Order
After drinking a little too much with Aragand, Olorin lets slip his secret: The Comradeship was created as a recruiting tool for the Grey Order. It's one of the ways it covertly finds apprentices.
Venerable Grand Comrade
Aragand somehow reached the rank of Venerable Grand Comrade. Not even Legles knows how or when that happened.
Aragand the Layabout's Sword
An impressive, but seemingly broken, two-handed sword. Aragand the Layabout likes to ramble on about how it only appears to be broken, and is, in fact, in mint condition.
Keigel's Natural Pig Swill
Only the worst low-life scum would ever deign to put this vile concoction to the taste. Worse, the after-effects of this vile brew are painful and accompanied with much vomiting.
Well-Travelled
Even before becoming a member of the Comradeship, Aragand has travelled the world many times over. Dwarfen beer, Norscan mead, Elvish wine, Kislevite vodka...
Patron of Taverns
Aragand is the type of bloke you see sitting in the corner of every tavern in the Empire. The cooks of the Moot are happy to have such a loyal customer and are more than eager to serve him.
Alone and Scruffy
Aragand's disheveled appearance is all a facade. His tattered cloths? Freer movement in combat. The dirt on his face? War paint used to scare his enemies. Or at least that's what he'll tell you.
Well-Drunk
...Bretonnian brandy, rotgut, Orcish bitters, kvas, samogon, koumiss, fungus beer, Zhufbar ale....
Drunken Master
When fighting under the influence, Aragand's movements are swaying and unpredictable. He says it's a technique he picked up while visiting some far eastern land.
Cold Culchan
After an ultimatum from Olorin, Aragand has decided to quite drinking. What could go wrong? What could go right?
Inspector Inquisitor Comrade
Legles has been part of the Comradeship for a long time and has seen four leaders come and go. He has been an Inspector Inquisitor Comrade for more than a hundred years, and is a little annoyed.
Friendship Bracelet
Giblit, for the sake of our friendship, please go steal from that sleeping dragon.
Ring of Concealment
The magical Ring of Concealment makes it very difficult for others to see its wearer.
Whirling Death
Bimbo's Book allows a Halfling leader to give some sage advice to his army. "Sage Advice" is Halfling for a good talking to.
Storm of Blades
What beauty and violence there is in the dance? A flurry of blades and a certain savagery of intent...
The Shadow Coils
The wending and twisting of the Wardancers hardens their spirits and their bodies against would-be attackers.
Woven Mist
The Wardancer threads and loops, contorting to create an ethereal fabric that turns aside arrows and bolts.
An Unlikely Friendship
A little encouragement goes a long way – a long way to having Legles's main source of entertainment stick around for a moment longer.
Prankster of Loec
Legles has taken it upon himself to steer Giblit into trouble whenever possible. He does this to push the failed Slayer out of comfort zone so that he may grow. It's also hilarious.
Feastmaster
As a servant of Loec, God of Revelry, Legles knows a thing or two about throwing feasts and festivals. Needless to say, he's a minor celebrity in the Moot.
Morning Constitutionals
Legles should really add a brisk walk back into his morning routine. In fact, it was on one of these morning constitutionals where he was forcibly befriended by a certain hapless dwarf.
Comrade and Brother Eternal
The rank of Comrade and Brother Eternal comes with many perks and responsibilities. Like cleaning the latrines and carrying Aragand around when he has fallen asleep.
Friendship Bracelet
This friendship bracelet represents the great task of repentance that lays before Giblit, being friends with an elf for the rest of his life.
Bimbo's Book of Sage Advice
Bimbo's Book allows a Halfling leader to give some sage advice to his army. "Sage Advice" is Halfling for a good talking to.
Self Preservation
Giblit would very much like to see tomorrow.
Gluttonous
Slayers suffer bouts of depression, and failed slayers doubly so. This often leads to periods when they glut themselves on alcohol or food.
Dragon Friend
It was fleeing from a dragon that made him broke his oath, all those years ago. In a very un-dwarfy manner, he holds no grudge, and is now quite fond of the beasts.
Slayer Memories
Giblit, for a time, was an experienced Slayer. While a different dwarf now, he still has those memories of past deeds, slaying trolls, giants, and even daemons.
Honorary Halfling
Even halflings sometimes mistake Giblit as one of their own, given his short stature, gentle disposition, and love of food.
Renewed Oath
While Giblit is unable (and unwilling) to take the Slayer Oath again, he is ready to make an oath that he will protect his friends in the Moot and the Comradeship.
Mirage
Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the winds from whence they came.
Blessing of the Elements
The magician utters a blessing onto the weapons of his allies, imbuing their attacks with the magic of the elements.
Sunstrike
Bright beams of burning energy leap from the wizard's eyes and scythe through all before him.
Sandstorm
Commanding the desert spirit of Da'ru'de, the sorcerer engulfs his foes in a swirling cloud of choking sand and dust.
Quicksand
The wizard turns the ground into bottomless quicksand, dragging any unfortunates down into the abyss.
Burning Hands
As if possessed by a Fire Efreet, the caster conjures scorching flames from his hands to burn his enemies to a crisp.
Curse of the Djinn
Channeling the immense powers of the Djinn through his own body, the sorcerer lays a terrible curse upon his foes.

Serpent Staff

Inside this ornate staff decorated with snake motifs is bound a malignant and ancient Serpent Djinn, imprisoned by powerful enchantments woven by Jaffar. Only Jaffar's will is strong enough to temporarily unleash it upon his enemies on the battlefield.
Black Book Of Ibn Naggazar

Ibn Naggazar was a brilliant, if somewhat maniacal Arabyan sorcerer. Whilst it is unknown whether his madness sprang from isolation, too many attempts at creating intoxicating elixirs or the honeyed promises of whispering daemons. There can be no doubt he was utterly mad.
Fakir Descendant
Let us turn the oasis into wine so that the crusaders may succumb to their beloved tipple.
Unyielding Stride
Moving across the sands of Araby tirelessly.
Sand Dwellers
Living in such a hostile land gives warriors and beasts alike a great advantage.
Conspirator of Evil
The Sultans Great power comes from making allies with those who posses it, but it comes at a price.
Kairos' Pact
Risen from the grave, Jaffar has made an unthinkable pact and seeks revenge on those who fell him.
Camel
Jaffar is a vainglorious man, it is no wonder then that the prestigious camel is one of his favourite mounts to ride into battle.
Royal Elephant
From on top the howdah of a mighty Arabyan Royal Elephant, Sultan Jaffar gazes down upon the battlefield with only imperious cruelty and disdain in his eyes.
Unbridled Ambition
Jaffar's hunger for power knows to bounds. There's no pact he won't make or enemy he won't crush on his path to conquest.
Slavemonger

During his initial unification of Araby, Jaffar condemned all those who opposed him to the life of a slave. So it shall be again; Arabyans, Estalians, Bretonnians, Greenskins, no matter who or what they are, all of Jaffar's enemies shall kneel before and serve the Great Sultan.
Serpent Guard
The Serpent Guard are Sultan Jaffar's personal elite bodyguard. They are devoted to their Sultan and aligned with Jaffar's goals of Arabyan dominance.
Cunning Charisma

Jaffar possesses a compelling charisma, which in the past allowed him to sway many Arabyan tribes and city-states to his side. His death and return to life certainly have not dulled his oratory skills.
Desires of Conquest
Nothing will stop me, not the Northerners, the Elves, the Dwarfs, Settra's lackeys or anyone else! I will rule this world, or see it burnt to ashes around me!
Will of Jaffar
No land shall remain beyond my grasp. No kingdom shall be beyond my mandate. Go forth. Conquer. Rule.
The Blade of Shadows
An esoteric, daemonic blade, its ghostly form in eternal transience between shape and shadow. Perhaps an ancient gift bestowed upon him by the Dark Gods.
Whispers in the darkness
The sound of the darkness seeping into the minds of those who come face to face with the Father in Shadow.
Night Wards
Be'lakor has resistance to magical attacks.
Eternal Terror
All those who see him fear him. Terror incarnate.
Shadow Shroud
A shadow hangs over Be'lakor, a barrier between him and the mortal world.
Insurmountable Rage
Be'lakor, watching from the heavens, screamed in fury as the chosen conqueror again fell in combat.
Violent Rise To Power
Master Of The Shadow
The path to power is paved with all those in the way
At the dawn of time, Be'lakor was blessed by all Chaos Gods. Be'lakor held the world in an iron fist, commanding hordes of daemons in the name of Chaos.
The Dark Master
Know now that the true master of Darkness has come.
Eons of Spite
A distaste for the Gods and mortals alike.
The First Deamon Prince
Be'lakor the Dark Master is the first Daemon Prince of Chaos and Father-in-Shadow to the current Everchosen, Archaon.
Primordial Everchosen
The first and true everchosen.
Timeless Rage
In the shadows of the worlds edge mountains, he watched as the hordes of chaos crashed against the walls of the Empire.
Chaos Incarnate
A force not to be wielded but to be unleashed Upon the mortal plains as Chaos incarnate.
Warrior Culture
Every able member of the tribes of Albion is trained in the use of at least one weapon to be able to fend off the daily dangers of the blighted lands.
Warleader's Guardians
Only the best and most accomplished warriors may join the ranks of the Hearthguard and become the personal guards of Chieftains and Warleaders.
Monsters of the Misty Isle
Many deadly abominations lure in the mists which shroud Albion, ready to defend it from any intruders.
Savage Warriors
Primitive they may be, but their unrivalled wildness and savage might easily make up for the lack of refinement.
Death from Afar
The hunt is part of the daily life of most inhabitants of Albion and the hunters joining the armies have steady arms and good eyes, sharpened by years of experience.
Fast Raiders
Hit before the enemy can defend themselves, be gone before they can hit back.
Trained Reflexes
Experienced warriors of Albion sometimes dodge missiles with seemingly unnatural reflexes gained from the experience of countless skirmishes.
Protective Charmes
The primitive, often savage-looking talismans still seem to have some protective effects.
Warcry
A mighty Warcrie at the right time can motivate warriors to fight harder and with renewed tenacity.
Champions of Albion
Hardened in many battles against the constant threats emerging from the bogs of the island, these veterans have superior skills compared to inexperienced troops.
Deadly Hunters
The best way to kill a foe is a well aimed arrow or boulder, killing them before they even know what happened.
Merciless Barbarians

With a combination of speed, agility and brutal savagery the defenders of Albion often seem more like a wave of flesh and steel, breaking their enemies in the charge and washing them away in a tide of blood.
Defenders of Myth

Forged by a great Dwarf runesmith as a gift to the Empire, this sword has powerful Dwarf runes carved upon its blade. The sword strikes with such force it penetrates all armour, and any undead troops hit by the sword suffer twice the normal damage.
The Enchanted Shield provides the bearer's regiment with an extra level of armour. This item can only be utilised by troops who are normally able to use a shield.

The Shield of Ptolos is magically inscribed with a myriad of distracting patterns and designs. The patterns magically distract arrows and bolts, sending them spinning off course. The bearer's regiment will be protected against missiles from bows, crossbows, war engines and so on. Additionally, the shield provides the bearer's regiment with a basic level of armour.

The Spelleater Shield is inscribed with symbols which have the power to absorb enemy magic. Whenever the bearer's regiment is the target of an enemy spell the shield has a good chance of absorbing the magic and channelling its power to any friendly mages. The shield can also negate the effects of enemy magic items. Additionally, the shield provides the bearer's regiment with a basic level of armour.
This magic helmet protects the bearer's regiment from the effects of fire or flame attacks. The magical powers are so effective that almost all such attacks will be ineffective.

This powerful wand channels the energy of the winds of magic, providing the bearer with extra magical powers. Any spell in the bearer's repertoire can be cast for fewer magic points than it would normally cost, to a minimum of one point.

The banner of Arcane Warding is inscribed with sigils to twist magic aside and deflect it in unpredictable paths. When a hostile spell is cast against a regiment bearing this banner the spell is likely to be either negated or deflected towards the closest enemy regiment.
This hallowed banner has been infused with power and can lash the enemy with bolts of pure energy. It may be cast, unleashing up to six mighty lightning bolts upon enemy troops within range

This powerful banner infuses the bearer's regiment with extra courage, making them braver and more determined. A regiment bearing this banner will never break from hand-to-hand combat and is immune to fear.
Shadow of the Horned Rat
Dark Omen
These warriors are veterans of the "Shadow of the Horned Rat" campaign. They learned hard how to stop Vermintide and Waagh.
These warriors are veterans of the "Dark Omen" campaign. They know pretty well, that the dead should not disturb the living.
Extra Powder
More Powder!
Because you can never have too much.
Where's that powder monkey? Get him up 'ere now!
The Bonds of War
Many regiments have come and gone but those few that bear the Grudgebringer name have developed a brotherhood like no other.
For Gold
If death is a reward, I'll take it in gold coin, old friend. The glory we'll leave for others.
Greater than Glory
I don't give a damn about glory, I do what I must.
The Forest's Roar
Swinging Boughs
Shield of the Forest
Striking Branches
Bolts of the Forest
Rain of Spines
Shifting Winds
Nature's Quiver
Let the enemy feel the fury of nature, embodied in these warriors as they crash through their lines.
Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.
The warrior strikes with the strength of a swinging tree limb; few can stand against such strength.
All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.
A ranger should give no reprieve to the foe. Arrows must fall like a deluge, as deadly as lightning.
The Asrai are fleet of foot, with centuries of darting from branch to branch, and never a missed step.
What is a ranger without an arrow? Who can be the best without dozens?
Let each bolt be imbued with the strength of Kurnous, and bring death to all his enemies.
Not all Trolls are created equally, a rare few possess some intelligence and are able to lead their own tribe.
A Troll Horde always hungers and the first to battle are the first to feed.
Fed by War
Too Stupid to Care
Trolls have a tendency to be too stupid to notice the fact that they should be afraid of a superior enemy. Sadly they also have a tendency to devour or break important supplies.
Devour them all!
In anticipation of a great feast, the trolls and monsters run faster and even shake off the toothpicks and pebbles that are launched to slow them down!
Born for bloody fights, skinwolves become a whirlwind of claws and teeth on the battlefield.
Bloodlust
Hit Harder
Hitting as hard as possible without getting tired fast is the pinnacle of Troll fighting techniques!
This Troll and his horde eat their enemies. And wounded comrades. Well, actually they eat about everything.
Motivated by Hunger but Insatiable
Stronger than most others of his kind, but easy to enrage.
Mighty but Choleric
Destructive
Hates every kind of structure and will destroy them. Yours as well as the enemies.
Obedient but Stupid as a Rock
Does everything the boss commands him to do. But whenever something unexpected happens, it all falls apart.
Intimidating but all Show
Makes a lot of noise, looks scary, but actually as brave as the average Skaven.
Completely Broken
The boss took control of this one so often that what little mind the troll had is completely gone. Even the dumbest troll notices that something is not right with this one.
Strong-Willed
It is not easy to force this Troll to do anything. Every time the boss is not checking on him, he goes off to do whatever comes to his mind.
All You Can Eat: Skaven
Easy to scare, numerous and everywhere, really. As long as one doesn't get tired of swinging their club around, no troll needs to go hungry!
The classics never get old. For preparation they just need to be squished well and voila, another troll meal ready.
Home Cooking: Humans
They need to be peeled out of their hard shell before consumption but have a uniquely intense taste.
Crustaceans: Dwarfs
Having tasted one of those, most trolls immediately want another. They just need to endure being showered with pointy sticks.
Haute Cuisine: Elves
Dry Aged Meat: Undead
Some trolls enjoy the soft texture of aged meat and sucking out the marrow of the bones. They just need to be brave enough to approach the living dead.
They often come running towards trolls, yelling and waving their sharp metal, so they are easy to collect. They also come in a smaller snack-sized variant for the smaller hunger.
Junk Food: Greenskins
Gamey Food: Beastmen
Combining the taste of wild animal and humans, some trolls are hooked on beastmen meat. They just need to be fast enough to catch them and match their wildness to best them.
Exotic Food: Lizardmen

It is not often that the trolls of the old world get to enjoy the meat of giant lizards. But the really big ones can feed a whole group of trolls when brought down and if you hit extra hard, then the scales are no problem at all either.

True Troll gourmets swear on the taste of chaos corrupted meat. It has a nice burning aftertaste like no other. They just need to make sure not to become the meal of the chaos creature themselves and match their savagery in combat.
Spicey Food: Chaos
Intelligence is not a requirement to earn Khornes favor.
Touched by Khorne
Grandfather Nurgle generously spreads his gifts throughout the mortal world, even to such unworthy beings as Trolls.
Touched by Nurgle
Even a Troll can catch the eye of the Prince of Excess - mostly because of their indulgence into gluttony.
Touched by Slaneesh
Either by lineage or by mutation, this Troll has some Frost Troll in him, enabling him to channel the frost of their Norscan home.
Frost Troll Blood
River Troll Blood
Either by lineage or by mutation, this Troll has some River Troll in him, enabling him to spew poison like his brethren.
Stone Troll Blood
Either by lineage or by mutation, this Troll has some Stone Troll in him, giving him the resilience of their kind.
The might of the untamed beast of the Norscan Wilds is unrivaled and few can withstand it.
Feral Masters

The boss can take direct control over his subjects, using them as puppets and breaking their will so far that they will never flee from battle. But even the dumbest monster will instinctively feel that their leader is obviously lacking leadership when the boss doesn't possess them.
Mind Controlled
Leader of Trolls
A truly intelligent troll, a rarity indeed.
Bringer of Destruction
The bosses ultimate goal is the destruction of all and any civilization. He has not much love for what it offers and will only begrudgingly use whatever the Norse towns offer to further his cause.
Troll Strategist
The boss repeatedly outmaneuvers the best generals in the world, especially when they underestimate him.
Man-Eater
Battle time is feeding time!
Battle-Hardened Kin
Even a troll will somehow improve if they survive enough battles. Fighting under the bosses leadership makes this even surprisingly likely.
Different from all other trolls, the boss knows what is valuable and worth keeping and what is junk.
Knowledgable Looter
The time of humans comes to an end. They have served their purpose as monsters flock to the bosses army. Only the dumb and greedy among humans will stay and fight for him.
Lord of the Monster Horde
These Trolls have braved the stormy cold planes, wastelands and hostile mountains of the North day for day. Those who survive long enough will be difficult to hurt let alone kill by normal means.
Scourge of the North
Blight of Men
The lands of weak mankind are teeming with Trolls, many of which are tougher, meaner and hungrier than the average troll. These trolls make fine recruits for the bosses army.
Instead of leading his forces properly, the Troll roars at the enemy, swings his weight around and does his best to frighten the opponent.
Intimidating
March of Eternal Winter
Where the boss goes, the land is warped by the power of Chaos - something the boss enjoys. And so he pushes his Horde ever onwards into foreign lands, to further the coming of his ice age.
Grabs and keeps whatever arouses his interest. Sadly, he has absolutely no sense for value. However, what the loot lacks in quality it makes up for in quantity.
Mindless Hoarder
Dumb Luck
Strolls right into cannon fire, is clumsy in combat and makes all the wrong choices. Still gets more often away with it than he has any right to.
Inhumane Stength
What trolls lack in elegance and grace they make up for in ferocity and pure strength.
Troll Boss
Big, mean and tough enough to make other monsters around him do...something. Sometimes even what he wants them to do.
Man-eater
Seeing a monster devouring their comrades - and mounts and sometimes spare equipment which looks remotely edible - is quite unsettling for most soldiers.
Big and Angry
Why is the food fighting back so much? This Troll wants to eat NOW! So he'll whack the food even harder until it stops moving so much!
Mountain Wanderer
Those living on the barren tops of snow-covered mountains develop phenomenal stamina and know how to move through rough terrain quickly.
Reckless Rampage
One of the main emotions of a snow troll in battle is anger. And if he was pocked by sharp pointy things often enough, he gets much angrier.
Troll Chief
Always Hungry
Hunger is the most effective way to make trolls take part in battles. The hungrier the troll, the more fighting he is willing to do.
Horrors of the Mountains
The Mountains are home not only to the steadfast Dawi, but also to the horrors that hunt them.
The lands of weak mankind are teeming with Trolls, many of which are tougher, meaner and hungrier than the average troll. These trolls make fine recruits for the army.
Children of Chaos
Trolls are creatures of chaos. They themselves may have forgotten about it, but they retained many of the twisted gifts the forces of chaos provide to their followers.
Unnatural Resilience
Flesh healing faster than weapons can wound it and skin thicker than most armour.
Deadly Menace
Trolls are everywhere in the old world and some of the more foolish inhabitants of these lands see them rather as a nuisance than a true danger.
Creatures of Ice and Snow
These Trolls seem to carry the very might of frost and ice within their veins.
Ugma's Fiends
The most feared and savage trolls march alongside Ugma to bring ruin over their foes.
King of Trolls
The boss leads ever-growing hordes of his kin against the weak forces of the South.
Mutant Regeneration
Troll flesh heals incredibly fast, allowing them to recover from almost any wound in no time.
Troll Toll
Only beta trolls hide under bridges!
River Troll Chieftain
Considering that Chief Ugma is a River Troll himself, it might not be too surprising that he is especially experienced in leading others of his kind.
Eloquent Troll
Chief Ugma loves to mock his enemies in their own language. It is surprisingly disturbing to hear a supposedly dumb Troll taunt in perfect Reikspiel.
Burning Hatred
Many trolls hate the Dwarfs and side with the Greenskins out of convenience. Ugma hates both sides of the conflict equally.
Warpstone-touched
Intelligence is not the only change the contact with warpstone caused in Chief Ugma. It also made him much tougher than the average troll.
The Strongest River Troll
No other River Troll can compare to Ugma. He is the toughest, meanest and strongest River Troll around. Even his stench is worse!
Ugma's Trophies and Trinkets

Ugma likes to collect treasures. He carries an assortment of small trinkets with him, taken from adventurers he has bested. Some of these trophies are magical and imbue the troll with beneficial effects.
Karak Azgal Stone Hammer

Chief Ugma's oversized hammer has probably been taken from the statue of a Dwarf hero or ancestor god in the fallen Karak Azgal. Chief Umga doesn't seem to care though, all that matters is that the hammer has the right size and doesn't break.
Chieftain of Karak Azgal
Ugma started as a leader of a small tribe of River Trolls in a fallen Karak, fighting and plundering adventurers who dared to brave the depths of this dangerous forsaken Dwarf hold.
Blight of Men
Pretender Hell-Mother

Having been ousted from her fortress at Schadensumpf by the ever-encroaching humans, Skattach has travelled far into the south along with the rest of her Clan in search of the lost Fimir homeland of the Wandering Isle. Believing to have found it in the marshes of the Badlands, she has proclaimed herself Hell-Mother, Meargh of all the Fimir.
Ancient Leadership
The Meargh are the respected and feared witch-queens of the Fimir. Skattach is at her prime as a Meargh, having ruled over her Clan for 800 hundred years.
Skattach's Fianna

From the moment took on the hated mantle of the Fimir Hell-Mother, Skattach keeps a personal guard of the most elite, skilled and loyal Fianna Fimm of her clan, lest any ambitious Dirach gets the wrong idea and tries to replace her with a more pliable Meargh.
Poison Mist
All Meargs naturally exude a magical mist that poisons and dazes all non-Fimir. Skattach's Mist is a particularly noxious one.
Venerable Hag
Most ruling Meargh are incredibly ancient, the oldest reaching thousands of years, as they age, their intelligence heightens and their skin hardens and wrinkles.
Witch-Queen of the Fimir
Being one of the Meargh, Skattach is a fearsome sorceress, able to easily mainupalte the winds of magic, and even lend some of her magical acumen to the lesser Dirach males.
Master Daemonologist

Fimir have a natural aptitude for summoning daemons, said to come from their half-daemonic heritage. The Meargh summon Daemons with  ease, casually summoning and binding thousands of lesser daemons on a daily basis to act as servants and warriors.
Staff of Balor's Eye

At the tip of this magical staff rests an ancient Fimir artifact known as "Balor's Eye" a magically preserved eye said to belong to the myterious Fimir god, able to open a rift into the Realm of Chaos and suck all of the user's enemies within.
Crown of the Hellmother

This thorny metal crown once belonged to the First Hellmother, a Meargh who united together all the ancient Fimir Clans. The Hellmother was a potent socreress, who placed many warding and magic amplifying enchantments upon her crown. Skattach has recently found the crown in  a journey to what she claims are the ruins of the Wandering Isle, the ancient lost homeland of the Fimir, and used it to claim the controversial mantle of the Hellmother.
Scythan Blood

Fatandira had always known she was of Arabyan Nomad stock, but only recently, with her journey to the Southlands, she has discovered her Scythan legacy. Her arrival proved fortuitous, for one of the Scythan tribal leaders had fallen to Chaos and was attempting to take control of the entire realm. It was then that the more righteous members of the tribe rallied around Fatandira, asking her to lead them against the servants of darkness.
Aimed Shot
Back in the Borderlands, Fatandira had quite the reputation as a crossbow markswoman among her troops. Since returning to her people, she has applied her skills to the Scythan way of the hunter.
Desert Huntress
Be as cunning as the sand fox, strike as swift as the falcon.
Enlightened Leadership
Since her tenure as Prince in the Borderlands, Fatandira has sought to end the bigotry and hate that plague any land she rules. Her principality might be long gone, but the ideal stands strong.
Nomad Cavalry Tactics

Even back in the Border Princes, Fatandira was well known for her cavalry tactics and the swiftness of her mounted troops. Imagine what she can do with a saddle-born people such as the Scythans under her command.
Al-Kahina

Since her arrival at Scythan lands, Fatandira has been hailed as "Al-Kahina", The Prophetess, by her people. The Scythans claim that she's the hero of legend that will banish the Darkness with the Golden God by her side. Fatandira herself doesn't quite believe the legend, but keeps up the appearance for the morale of her troops and well-being of her people.
A Better Life
...From now on my destiny will be to lift these people out of ignorance and poverty, to prevent them from becoming as paranoid and vicious as the villagers who butchered my family. This I swear.
Straightforward Commander
Fatandira is a woman with an iron determination. She leads honestly, and personally ensures that her troops have talent in battle and good sense out of it.
Desert Feint
Fatandira has adapted her famously stealthy cavalry strikes from the rough terrain of the Border Princes to the sands of Araby and Nehekhara almost seamlessly.
Blades of Honourable Demise
Taken by Fatandira from the tomb of the Liche Lord Karitamen in the Borderlands, this pair of Nehekharan Khopeshes magically enhance their owner's combat skills, and weakens anyone struck by them.
Warhorse
Born to a family of Arabyan caravan nomads, Fatandira is as comfortable on the saddle as on foot.
Saqir

Given to Fatandira as a gift by the Scythans, Saqir is a mighty specimen of Desert Roc, giant and intelligent birds of prey that fly high above the deserts of Araby. The animal quickly bonded with her, and now they soar the battlefield together.
Cuirass of the Brave Queen

This ancient magical lamellar cuirass is said to have belonged to a legendary warrior queen of the Scythans who killed one of the great Priest Kings of Ancient Nehekhara in battle. The Scythans, believing Fatandira to be a reincarnation of that queen, have granted to her this ancient artifact.
Those proved in battle may take a sacred vow to their god Tutankhanut and serve as his mortal champion.
Vow to Tutankhanut
Eminent Elementalist

The Golden Magus' mastery over the elements of air, fire and water is exceptional, especially for a human. His powers come from his most prized possessions, 3 Royal Djinns from who he draws his magical might from.
Aethyric Tether

The secret of the Golden Magus' sorcerous might resides in his connection, or "aethyric tether" with 3 magic urns in his possession. Imprisoned inside are 3 powerful elemental spirits, siphoned of their power for the Magus' benefit.
Old but Gold
For someone who cultivates the image of an elderly eccentric scholar, the Golden Magus is surprisingly spry, fast and adept at combat.
In the Changer's Sphere
Some whisper that the Magus is in complete thrall of the malignant Architect of Fate. Nonsense, of course, but like with all good rumours, there's might be a grain of truth to it...
Sultan of the Seas

Beneath all the eccentricity and gaudiness hides a callous corsair, eager to bring more magical treasures to his collection, more slaves to his servitude, more concubines to his harem and more power to himself.
Master of Sorcery

The Golden Magus can impart much knowledge onto those aspirants willing to learn the sorcerous arts - if they can stand the eccentric nature of his lessons and the Magus' ever so condescending manners.
Master of the Djinn

The Golden Magus is an expert in the art of binding the elemental spirits known as "djinns" to his will. Stored in the Magus' flagship are thousands of warded urns, each containing a potent djinn ready and willing to obey his every command.
Wishmaster

The Magus has enslaved many a djinn to his will, to such degree that they cannot reject any of his wishes and commands. Djinns though are capricious and free-spirited entities, and their service should not be taken for granted.
The Flaming Scimitar

One of the Golden Magus' most infamous creations, this fiery curved sword is kept most of the time inside a jar filled with a slimy orange solution. When drawn out of it, the sword catches a mystical fire that the Magus' uses for battle, theatrics and summoning Djinn spirits. Contrary to popular belief, the ship is named after the sword.
Auric Robes

The Magus' ostentatious golden robes are not just a flamboyant show of wealth, they possess potent enchantments that the Magus discovered in a parchment at the ruined city of Bel-Aliad. Besides providing protection from harm, these wards are curiously nocive to the Undead.
Camel
Though vigorous for his old age, the Golden Magus often rides to battle on one of his many camels - out of flamboyance if anything else.
Djinn Skiff

Much like the Magus' infamous flagship, this enchanted skiff is proof of his mastery over the Djinn. Held "afloat" on the air by servile Lesser Tempest Djinn oarsmen, this is one of the Golden Magus' favourite ways to ride to battle.
Sea's Bounty
From the sea we take, to the sea we give.
For the Moot!
“There's power in stories. That's all history is: the best tales. The ones that last. Might as well be mine.”
Hyshia

No one is quite sure of how a Halfling adventurer has gotten his hands onto a Druchii Repeater Crossbow, and what's even stranger, the weapon is enchanted with the White Wind of Magic. Could any of Glibfoot's braggadocious tales be actually true?
Cipher Blade

Glibfoot claims that the High Elves of Ulthuan gifted him this small magical blade as thanks for single-handedly defeating a Greenskin invasion of the Asur Homeland. In reality, it is a trinket "borrowed" from the chambers of an Elven Archmage, an enchanted letter opener with the ability to magically "open" almost anything... armour included.
Thief Tactics
The Halflings' natural skill for "borrowing" is widely known, but Glibfoot's expertise in stealth and thievery is one of the few things about him that are actually legendary.
'Scourge of Orcs & Goblins'
Whether fake or real, Glibfoot's outlandish stories about slaying scores of Greenskins do certainly inspire courage in the Halflings under him.
Larger than Life
If anything, Glibfoot knows how to tell his adventures, fictitious or else. Some of his published tales, like "Hard in Hochland", are popular all across the Empire and beyond.
A True Hero
No more theatrics, no more lies. Now is the time for honest action and real courage.
A Raunchy Tale
You know, this reminds me of the time I snuck into the court of the Witch King of the Druchii and had a tryst with Hag Queen Morathi in her own chambers, let me tell you this most salacious story...
A Grim Tale

...and there was I, fighting alongside Emperor Karl Franz, Luthor Huss, the Huntsmarshal and the Elder of the Moot himself! Together we would make a last stand against the Hordes of Chaos at Zanbaijin, the bloody arena of champions...
An Under Tale

...so I ended up there, in the dark bowels of Karak-Eight-Peaks, the Dwarfen City of Pillars, crushing filthy grobi and raki skulls with my bare hands next to mighty heroes such as fearless Gotrek, the stern King Belegar and even the legendary White Dwarf! As the Dawi say, many a Grudge was avenged that day...
A Chivalrous Tale

...and It was during one my adventures through Fair Bretonnia, that, while relieving myself in one of its beautiful ponds, the fabled Lady of the Lake appeared before me! By her side, covered in the mist of legends, was the Green Knight himself! And so they revealed my most sacred duty... to lead a holy quest into Foul Mousillon, the cursed city of undeath...
And the Adventure Continues!

...but this is not the end of my tale, my fellow Halflings! There remain many of my great adventures yet to tell; My perilous trek through exotic Lustria! My quest for the fabled Casket of Souls at the Pyramid of Doom in Ancient Nehekhara! And finally, the glorious endless feasts in the realm of Greasus Goldtooth, Overtyrant of All Ogres!
The Comradeship

The Comradeship was an elite group of heroes from all across the Empire sworn to defend the Moot and it's inhabitants. Glibfoot has made a call for all those brave enough to once again join together in defense of all Halflings against the Forces of Destruction.
Wardens of the Moot
The Mootland Wardens are as elite as it gets when it comes to Halfling warriors. Glibfoot has promised double the food they get now if they redouble their efforts in defending the Moot.
A Place in the Songs
With me now, Heroes of Mootland! Not for honour, not for wealth, but for the chance to do a good deed and earn a place in the songs!
A Good Deed, A Good Meal
At the end of the day, Glibfoot and his followers are still Halflings. And Halflings know the only true maxim of warfare; an army marches on its stomach, and Halfling stomachs really are something.
For the Moot!
“There's power in stories. That's all history is: the best tales. The ones that last. Might as well be mine.”

In reality, it is a trinket "borrowed" from the chambers of an Elven Archmage, an enchanted letter opener with the ability to magically "open" almost anything... armour included.
Thief Tactics
The Halflings' natural skill for "borrowing" is widely known, but Glibfoot's expertise in stealth and thievery is one of the few things about him that are actually legendary.
Halfling of the People
Fieldwardens are esteemed figures in Halfling society, they know everyone and everyone knows them. Their sole presence can instill courage in the heart of fellow Halflings.
Friendly Competition
The presence of a Fieldwarden often leads nearby Halflings to try and outdo each other in an effort to impress the Fieldwarden.
Border Patrols
Lone Fieldwardens are often posted in the forests and hills at the borders of the Moot in order to stop any covert enemy incursions.
Defender of the Moot
And stay out, unless you want the next one to hit something more sensitive!
The Art of Cooking
A true master of his craft, the dishes of the Master Chef are so potent that they can alter the course of battle. Yes, with food, these are Haflings we're talking about.
Beef & Beer Pie
The smell of Halfling pies actually could raise the dead from the grave. Might even be why the Undead keep invading.
The Feast is Coming!
Doesn't matter if you're a Halfling, an Ogre or something else, the promise of good grub is worth fighting for.
Hot Spices
Recently imported from Lustria, these curious red thin peppers emit a pungent smell even from a good distance.
In Defense of the Moot
The Halflings of the Moot are a peaceful and pastoral people, but their bravery in defence of their homeland against Undead and Greenskin incursions should not be doubted
For All That Is Pure and Good
They have mistaken our love of peace for weakness! To battle, for the Moot!
Spill the Soup!
On a desperate situation, the Master Chef will spill a pot containing the famously explosive "Hot Pot" stew recipe on nearby enemies.... and himself.
Smallfolk Luck
Halflings seem to be preternaturally lucky and oddly resistant to even the darkest, dangerous magic.
Some Master Chefs choose to carry their kitchen onto the battlefield in a chuck wagon.
Many Halfling commanders choose to ride pigs into battle. Hey, what, stop laughing.
Many Halfling commanders choose to ride the largest Moot Cockerel specimens into battle.
